pronunciation:
FRO'WARD, [Latin versus:turned or looking from.]
Perverse,

definitions.text:
Perverse, that is, turning from, with aversion or reluctance; not willing to yield or comply with what is required; unyielding; ungovernable; refractory; disobedient; peevish; as froward child.
They are very froward generation, children in whom is no faith. Deuteronomy 32:20.
